back_text:
Easy / Standard - Act 2
[skull]: -X. X is your location's column number.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 resource on this card, as a switch.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, move the Mine cart once.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, remove 1 switch from this card.
name: Written in Rock
text:
Easy / Standard - Act 1
[skull]: -X. X is your location's column number.
[cultist]: -1. Place 1 resource on this card, as a scrap.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, remove 1 scrap from this card.
[elder_thing]: -5. Remove 1 switch from this card.

back_text:
Hard / Expert - Act 2
[skull]: -X. X is twice your location's column number.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 resource on this card, as a switch.
[tablet]: -4. Move the Mine Cart once.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 damage.

text:
Hard / Expert - Act 1
[skull]: -X. X is twice your location's column number.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 resource on this card, as a scrap.
[tablet]: -4. Remove 1 scrap from this card.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 damage.

name: Prismatic Shard
text:
Uses (4 brilliance).
[reaction] When a scenario card effect would discard any number of cards from your hand, exhaust Prismatic Shard and spend 1 brilliance: Ignore that effect and draw that many cards, instead.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is twice your current floor number (to a minimum of 2).
[cultist]: -2. If you succeed and your location is an enemy, exhaust it.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, heal 1[per_investigator] damage from the nearest enemy-location.
[elder_thing]: -5. If it is agenda 2a or 3a, after this test resolves, remove this token from the chaos bag and add it to the predation bag.
name: Hemlock House
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is your current floor number (to a minimum of 1).
[cultist]: -1. If your location is an enemy, exhaust it.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, heal 1 damage from the nearest enemy-location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, and it is agenda 2a or 3a, after this test resolves, remove this token from the chaos bag and add it to the predation bag.

name: Little Sylvie
text: [reaction] When Little Sylvie is discarded from your hand or deck: Play it (paying its cost). [reaction] When a scenario card effect would discard a card from your hand or deck, exhaust Little Sylvie: Place that card on top of your deck, instead.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of revealed [[Cave]] locations in play.
[cultist]: -1. If you succeed by 2 or more, heal 1 horror.
[tablet]: -4. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, treat this token's modifier as -6 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If an [[Abomination]] enemy is at your location, this test automatically fails instead.
name: The Lost Sister
text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of revealed [[Cave]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. If you succeed, heal 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, treat this token's modifier as -4 instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If an [[Abomination]] enemy is at your location, reveal another token.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of [[Insect]] enemies in play and in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, you may shuffle a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the victory display into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -5. Ready the nearest [[Insect]] enemy. It moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you are a [[Lair]] location, you automatically fail.
name: The Silent Heath
text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Insect]] enemies in play and in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. You may shuffle a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the victory display into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, choose an [[Insect]] enemy at your location. It engages you and makes an immediate attack.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you are a [[Lair]] location, reveal another token.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of [[Sunken]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, you may remove 1 sinkhole from the nearest [[Bog]] location.
[tablet]: -5. Place 1 damage on the nearest [[Bog]] location, as a sinkhole.
[elder_thing]: -5. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Grasping Tendril enemy and draw it, ignoring its surge keyword.
name: The Thing in the Depths
text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Sunken]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. You may remove 1 sinkhole from the nearest [[Bog]] location.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 damage on the nearest [[Bog]] location, as a sinkhole.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Grasping Tendril enemy and draw it, ignoring its surge keyword.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is twice the current darkness level.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, heal 1 damage from your investigator.
[tablet]: -4. Find the enemy in pursuit with the highest evade. Spawn it at your location.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 horror.
name: The Twisted Hollow
text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current darkness level.
[cultist]: -1. Heal 1 damage from your investigator.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, find the enemy in pursuit with the highest evade. Spawn it at your location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, take 1 horror.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of doom in play.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 barrier at your location.
[tablet]: -4. The nearest enemy readies, moves, and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -5. Remove a barrier, decoy, or trap at your location.
name: The Longest Night
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of doom in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 barrier at your location.
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, the nearest enemy readies, moves, and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, remove 1 barrier, decoy, or trap at your location.

name: Barriers, Decoys, and Traps
text: Token Effects Enemies that ignore a token's effects do not trigger its Forced abilities. Resource Forced – When an enemy would move via a keyword and 1 or more barriers are between its location and the location it is moving to: Remove one of those barriers. Cancel the effects of the move. Horror Forced – When an enemy enters a location with a decoy: Remove the decoy. Deal 1 damage to that enemy, disengage it from each investigator, and exhaust it. That enemy cannot ready for the remainder of the round. Damage Forced – When an enemy enters a location with a trap: Remove the trap. Deal 2 damage to that enemy.

back_flavor: The first rays of dawn send streaks of violet and crimson across the sky, blotting out the stars. As you face the oncoming dawn, a fallen monstrosity rises from a heap of mangled corpses to charge toward you. You barely have time to react!
back_text: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): - Each undefeated investigator suffers 1 mental trauma. - Choose a resident under an investigator's control. That resident steps between you and the monstrosity, sacrificing themselves. In the Campaign Log, cross out the chosen resident's name. In that Resident's notes, record [name] sacrificed themselves for the investigators. Advance the act.
flavor: Your only hope is to last until dawn.
name: The Onslaught
text: When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it. Forced – When a card effect would place doom on the agenda: Place it on The Captives story asset instead. Forced – After doom is placed on this agenda: In player order, each investigator draws the top card of the Enemy deck.

back_name: By the Skin of Your Skin
back_text:
If 4 or fewer damage is on The Captives:
Despite the seemingly endless onslaught, relatively few of the captives were harmed. As you survey the wrecked interior of the farmhouse, some captives weep into their hands, and others look at you accusingly. How can you convince them that their lives were worth saving?
(→R1) (page 50).
Otherwise:
The farm is a charnel house of gore and viscera. When confronted with the onslaught, many of the captives ran, screaming, into the jaws of the monstrosities. The morning light illuminates a scene that will haunt your dreams.
(→R2) (page 50).
flavor: You must protect the captives!
name: The Longest Night
text: [free] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Place 1 barrier, decoy, or trap at your location. [action]: Resign. Then, if each undefeated investigator has resigned, (→R3) (page 50). Objective – Survive the night and protect as many captives as you can. (Do not advance until you are instructed.)

back_flavor:
The aspect of the whole farm was shocking— greyish withered grass and leaves on the ground, vines falling in brittle wreckage from archaic walls and gables.
<cite>H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"</cite>
back_text: The Farmhouse cannot have player card attachments, traps, or decoys.
name: The Farmhouse
text: The Farmhouse cannot have player card attachments, traps, or decoys. [free] During your turn, spend 1 [per_investigator] resources: Move (to a connecting location). [action]: Gain 1 clue (from the token pool). (Group limit once per round.)

back_flavor: The old farm is riddled with scraps, desiccated livestock, rotten feed, and rusted farming equipment.
name: Milkhouse
text:
[reaction] When you would place a decoy or a trap at Milkhouse: Place it at an adjacent location instead.
[action]: Draw 1 set-aside Fire! treachery. Shuffle 1 copy of a set-aside Fire! treachery into the encounter deck. (Limit once per round.)

back_flavor: The old farm is riddled with scraps, desiccated livestock, rotten feed, and rusted farming equipment.
flavor: The grapes are all skin and pop like puffballs when touched.
name: Vineyard
text: [free] During your turn: Engage an enemy at Vineyard. (Limit once per turn.) Forced – When an enemy enters Vineyard: Heal 1 damage from it.

back_flavor: The old farm is riddled with scraps, desiccated livestock, rotten feed, and rusted farming equipment.
name: Coop
text:
While there is a decoy on Coop, this location gets -2 shroud.
Each enemy at Coop gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
[action]: Draw 1 set-aside Fire! treachery. Shuffle 1 copy of a set-aside Fire! treachery into the encounter deck. (Limit once per round.)

back_flavor: The old farm is riddled with scraps, desiccated livestock, rotten feed, and rusted farming equipment.
flavor: The barn looks like it could collapse at any moment.
name: Barn
text: Enemies at Barn get +1 damage value. [reaction] When Barn is revealed: Place the set-aside Ajax story asset at this location ([codex] Ω).

back_flavor: The old farm is riddled with scraps, desiccated livestock, rotten feed, and rusted farming equipment.
name: Pasture
text: [free] During your turn, if Pasture has a trap on it: Move (to a connecting location). Forced – After a ready, unengaged enemy moves into Pasture via a keyword, if there are no barriers at Pasture: Resolve that keyword again.

back_flavor:
All the verdure was going grey, and was developing a highly singular quality of brittleness.
 - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"
name: Outer Fields
text:
[action]: Move an enemy to a connecting location. (Group limit once per game.)
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from this location: Heal 2 damage from The Captives. (Group limit once per game.)

back_flavor:
All the verdure was going grey, and was developing a highly singular quality of brittleness.
 - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"
name: Outer Fields
text: [free] During your turn: Look at the top 1 [per_investigator] cards of the Enemy deck. Discard any number of them and put the rest back on top in any order. (Group limit once per game.)

back_flavor:
All the verdure was going grey, and was developing a highly singular quality of brittleness.
 - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"
name: Outer Fields
text:
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from this location: Place 1 barrier at this location.
[free] During your turn: Choose a barrier at any location and move it to any other location. (Limit once per turn.)

back_flavor:
All the verdure was going grey, and was developing a highly singular quality of brittleness.
<cite>H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"</cite>
name: Outer Fields
text:
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from this location: Place 1 trap at this location.
[free] During your turn: Choose a trap at any location and move it to any other location. (Limit once per turn.)

back_flavor:
All the verdure was going grey, and was developing a highly singular quality of brittleness.
<cite>H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"</cite>
name: Outer Fields
text:
[reaction] After you discover the last clue from this location: Place 1 decoy at this location.
[free] During your turn: Choose a decoy at any location and move it to any other location. (Limit once per turn.)

name: The Captives
text: During the enemy phase, each ready, unengaged enemy at The Farmhouse attacks as though it were engaged with The Captives. Horror dealt to The Captives in this way is dealt as damage instead. Forced – When The Captives story asset is defeated: (→R3) (page 50).

name: Ajax
text: Your first action each round does not provoke attacks of opportunity. [action] Exhaust Ajax: Move. Either move twice, or choose any [[Field]] location and move to it. [action] If Ajax is at your location: Take control of him. Any player at Ajax's location may trigger this ability.

name: Ursine Hybrid
text: Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Prey – Lead investigator. Ursine Hybrid gets +3 [per_investigator] health and ignores barriers and decoys. While this enemy is moving, each [[Field]] location is considered connected to one another.

name: Molting Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (east). Aloof. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Molting Hybrid ignores barriers. Forced – When Molting Hybrid would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.

name: Molting Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (south). Aloof. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Molting Hybrid ignores barriers. Forced – When Molting Hybrid would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.

name: Molting Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (west). Aloof. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Molting Hybrid ignores barriers. Forced – When Molting Hybrid would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.

flavor:
...strangely, they didn't howl. They laughed.
 - Dr. Rosa Marquez, <u>Miskatonic Survey, 1926</u>
name: Lupine Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (north). Retaliate. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Forced – After Lupine Hybrid attacks: Heal 1 damage from it.

flavor:
...strangely, they didn't howl. They laughed.
 - Dr. Rosa Marquez, <u>Miskatonic Survey, 1926</u>
name: Lupine Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (east). Retaliate. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Forced – After Lupine Hybrid attacks: Heal 1 damage from it.

flavor:
...strangely, they didn't howl. They laughed.
 - Dr. Rosa Marquez, <u>Miskatonic Survey, 1926</u>
name: Lupine Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (south). Retaliate. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Forced – After Lupine Hybrid attacks: Heal 1 damage from it.

flavor:
I suppose that, like any goat, it eats everything.
 - Dr. Rosa Marquez, <u>Miskatonic Survey, 1926</u>
name: Capra Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields location with the fewest enemies. Alert. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Capra Hybrid ignores decoys.

name: Equine Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (north). Patrol (The Farmhouse). Equine Hybrid ignores traps. Forced – When Equine Hybrid would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.

name: Equine Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (east). Patrol (The Farmhouse). Equine Hybrid ignores traps. Forced – When Equine Hybrid would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.

name: Equine Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields (west). Patrol (The Farmhouse). Equine Hybrid ignores traps. Forced – When Equine Hybrid would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.

name: Slithering Hybrid
text: Spawn – Outer Fields location with the most enemies. Aloof. Patrol (The Farmhouse). Slithering Hybrid ignores barriers, decoys, traps, and damage from Fire! treacheries.

name: Endless Night
text: Peril. Revelation – You must decide (choose one): - Remove 1 doom from the agenda. - Deal 2 damage to The Captives story asset. - Take 3 direct damage and 3 direct horror.

name: Incursion
text: Revelation – Test [agility] (X). X is half the number of doom in play (rounded up). For each point you fail by, choose a different [[Mutated]] enemy nearest to The Farmhouse and ready it. Each chosen enemy moves, engages, and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Colour]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -6. Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
[tablet]: -8. You may place 1 doom on your investigator card to treat this token's modifier as -3, instead.
[elder_thing]: -5. If this is a fight or evasion attempt against a Cosmic Emissary, you automatically fail instead.
name: Fate of the Vale
text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, discard 1 card at random from your hand.
[tablet]: -5. You may place 1 doom on your investigator card to treat this token's modifier as 0, instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If this is a fight or evasion attempt against a Cosmic Emissary, reveal another token.

name: Cosmic Emissary
text: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

name: Cosmic Emissary
text: Massive. Retaliate. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

name: Cosmic Emissary
text: Massive. Alert. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

name: Cosmic Emissary
text: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

flavor:
"Most of the creatures seemed not quite usual in their aspects and motions..."
 - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Colour Out of Space"
name: Swarm
text: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either lose 1 resource or take 1 damage.

flavor:
"...there descended such a blinding sheet of torrential rain that shelter became imperative."
 - H.P. Lovecraft, "The Lurking Fear"
name: Downpour
text: Revelation – Test [intellect] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either lose 1 action or place 1 of your clues on your location.

flavor: I am the eyes I am all eyes that see
name: Otherworldy Visions
text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +2 difficulty if there is a [[Colour]] enemy at your location. For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or discard 1 card at random from your hand.

back_flavor: Bertie approaches, absolutely winded. "Dr. Marquez requests your immediate presence," he huffs, butting into your conversation. "And believe me, she will not like it if you're late at all."
back_text: Each investigator resigns (→R1) (page 9).
flavor: The Miskatonic Survey is staying in Hemlock Vale and making preparations for today's expedition. The more the locals trust you, the better you will understand the nature of Hemlock Isle.
name: Welcome to Hemlock Vale!
text: Forced - When you draw a weakness: cancel its revelation effect and discard it.

back_text:
If you flipped this act while or after playing the Dawn of the First Day prelude, read the following:
The sweetness of the air and the vibrant colors are overwhelming. Your pulse is electric as gooseflesh creeps up your arm and your skin prickles, almost as if under an invisible caress. You are not alone, you never were alone, but the one who is with you is you, and you, and you, and you, and you and you and and and and You catch yourself staring up at the glassy sky, bewildered and drunk with wonder.
You (and only you) earn 1 bonus experience (do not spend it until instructed)
flavor: The village brims with excitement! Children play along the roadside wearing animal masks, while others hang gaudy flowers on eaves and along fences.
name: Dawn of the First Day
text: Investigators cannot take damage/horror or be defeated. Objective - Befriend the locals and prepare for the first survey! (Refer to the rules on page 6 for more information on preludes)

back_flavor: You reconvene back the boarding house. Ms. Olmstead lays out a spread of warm buttered cornbread, roasted radishes the size of your fist, and a pile of grey oily eggs. Your stomach growls as you nibble on some of your field rations rather than partake.
back_text: Check the campaign log: If Bertie was rescued, (→R1) (page 42). Otherwise, (→R2) (page 42).
flavor: Dreary clouds threaten rain as thunder rumbles overhead. Locals bustle about making preparations.
name: Dark Clouds
text: Forced - When you draw a weakness: cancel its revelation effect and discard it.

back_text:
If you flipped this act while or after playing the Dawn of the Second Day prelude, read the following:
As you walk through the village, a wave of dizziness washes over you and you stumble forward, putting your hand out to steady yourself. You cut your palm on the corner of a stack of mirrors and cry out in pain as thick, heavy raindrops begin to fall.
([codex] 17) (page 42).
flavor: The village continues preparations with cheery resolve, despite the dour weather.
name: Dawn of the Second Day
text: Investigators cannot take damage/horror or be defeated. Objective - Talk to the locals and learn more about Hemlock Isle!

name: The Hemlock Curse
text: This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it. If this skill test fails, discard each card in your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if The Hemlock Curse is in your hand: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

back_text:
Check the Campaign Log. If Bertie had an epiphany:
You reconvene with Dr. Marquez at the Boarding House. Bertie approaches you with a manic gleam in his eye, wearing the white-gold cloak of the Vale. "I've decided to join the Feast today - for the whole day. I understand this may put my grant in jeopardy but -" Before Dr. Marquez can chastise him, the young man scampers off past a throng of dancers.
(→R2) (page 54).
Otherwise:
You reconvene with Dr. Marquez at the Boarding House. Bertie approaches you and the professor with obvious excitement. "I've had a revelation about Hemlock Isle. The food chain is chaos. Predators predated by prey - poetic, isn't it? Something in the food or water induces a frenzy - in fact, this entire celebration is kind of frenzy," he gestures to the giddy figures and dancing children.
(→R1) (page 54).
flavor: The people of the Vale dance with an almost manic energy. Riotous music and a sweet perfume scent hang in the air.
name: All is Full of Love
text: Forced – When you draw a weakness: Cancel its revelation effect and discard it.

back_text:
If you flipped this act while or after playing the Dawn of the Final Day prelude, read the following:
you cannot say why but you know why you are here you are here to watch to see to know to perceive to feel to understand to hold in your heart the truth of the cosmos which is that you are but a mote of dust in the brilliant light of infinity and that a single puff of air will send you spiraling into oblivion a single moment and you will cease to be if you even ever were why did you look into the brilliance why did you stare so long at the shining blinding brightness of the stars
You must either suffer 1 mental trauma or search the collection for a random basic [[Madness]] weakness and add it to your deck. It does not count toward your deck size. You earn 2 bonus experience.
flavor: A beautiful sheen hangs over everything, shimmering in the air around you.
name: Dawn of the Final Day
text: Objective – Talk to the locals and prepare yourself for the Feast.

back_flavor: Glowing spores hang in the air around the effigy, lighting up the mirrors and bathing the festival in a faerie glow. You breathe in and feel your mouth and throat buzz with a light, tingling sensation. The last thing you hear as you pas out is the sound of lilting flutes and tambourines.
back_text: Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental or 1 physical trauma.
flavor: Revelers dance to raucous music while others gorge themselves on rank platters of oily food. Visitors and locals alike collapse in fits of laughter while others claw at their eyes. Each of them wear a wild, gleeful smile.
name: Around the Table
text: Objective – Confront Mother Rachel! If Mother Rachel is defeated: (→R1).

back_flavor:
"Well done," Mother Rachel says to you. Lights dance in the sky overhead as the last of the Vale residents are led dutifully to their place at the table. Some look at you with rueful expressions, rightfully betrayed. As you move to assume your place at the table, Mother Rachel steps in your way.
"It is not your place to sit with us. You are our guest of honor," she smiles. You feel a sharp blow to the back of your head, and then nothing.
back_text:
"Well done," Mother Rachel says to you. Lights dance in the sky overhead as the last of the Vale residents are led dutifully to their place at the table. Some look at your with rueful expressions, rightfully betrayed. As you move to assume your place at the table, Mother Rachel steps in your way. "It is not your place to sit with us. You are our guest of honor," she smiles. You feel a sharp blow to the back of your head, and then nothing.
Each investigator resigns.
flavor: You must gather Mother Rachel's flock, willing or not, to their place at the table.
name: Lambs to the Slaughter
text: You cannot trigger [codex] codex entries. [reaction] After you evade a [[Resident]] enemy by 2 or more: Add them to the victory display. Objective – If 1 plus 1 [per_investigator] [[Resident]] cards are in the victory display, (→R3) (page 60).

flavor: Dozens of visitors gather around the base of the effigy.
name: The Crossroads
text: [action]: You ask the locals about the Vale ([codex] 10). [fast] If there are exactly 1 or 2 investigators in the game, during your turn: Move (to a connecting location). (Group limit once per round.)

flavor: A crowd of revelers dance around a roaring bonfire. Mother Rachel stands before it, smiling broadly.
name: The Crossroads
text: [action]: Parley. You exhort the locals for help. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, move 1 damage from your investigator to a [[Resident]] enemy at The Crossroads.

flavor: The mill appears to have been overtaken by sharp, knotted vines and fecund vegetation.
name: The Old Mill
text: [action] [action]: Discover 1 clue at The Old Mill.

flavor: The daylight gives way to long, sinister shadows.
name: The Old Mill
text: [action]: You investigate the sounds of something rustling in the undergrowth ([codex] 12).

name: Frenzied Reveler
text: Forced – When Frenzied Reveler is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, remove Frenzied Reveler from the game.

name: Mother Rachel
text: While you control Mother Rachel, you have 1 additional arcane slot. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 1). Forced - After Mother Rachel is defeated: Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.

name: Leah Atwood
text: While you control Leah Atwood, you get +1 [combat]. [action]: Parley. Test [combat](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 2). Forced - After Leah Atwood is defeated. Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.

name: Simeon Atwood
text: While you control Simeon Atwood, you get +1 [agility]. [action]: Parley. Test [agility](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 3). Forced - After Simeon Atwood is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

name: William Hemlock
text: While you control William Hemlock, you get +1 [intellect]. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 4). Forced - After William Hemlock is defeated. Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

name: River Hawthorne
Gideon Mizrah
text: While you control Gideon Mizrah, you have 1 additional accessory slot. [action] [action]: Parley. ([codex] 6). Forced - After Gideon Mizrah is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

name: Judith Park
text: While you control Judith Park, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to fight. [action] Spend X resources, where X is the current day number: Parley. ([codex] 7). Forced - After Judith Park is defeated: Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.

name: Theo Peters
text: While you control Theo Peters, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to move. [action] Choose and discard X cards from your hand, where X is the current day number: Parley. ([codex] 8). Forced - After Theo Peters is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

name: Bertie Musgrave
text: While you control Bertie Musgrave, you get +1 health and + 1 sanity [fast] Take either 1 damage or 1 horror and exhaust Bertie Musgrave: Parley. Draw 1 card ([codex] Ω). Forced - After Bertie Musgrave is defeated: Set him aside, out of play.

flavor: "If it's survival of the fittest, I intend to survive."
name: Dr. Rosa Marquez
text: While you control Dr. Rosa Marquez, you get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location ([codex] Ω).

flavor: "Change is inevitable. The question is how we weather it."
name: Helen Peters
text: (Day [day]) you get +1 [combat]. (Night [night]) you get +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you enter a location, exhaust Helen Peters and deal 1 damage to her: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and automatically evade it.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current day number.
[cultist]: -1. If this is a parley attempt, treat this token's modifier as a +1, instead.
[tablet]: -4. If you have fewer than 2 cards in hand, treat this token's modifier as -2 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If this is a parley attempt, reveal another token.
name: The Vale
text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current day number.
[cultist]: +1. If this is a parley attempt, you automatically succeed.
[tablet]: -2. If you have fewer than 3 cards in hand, treat this token's modifier as 0 instead.
[elder_thing]: -1. If this is a parley attempt, reveal another token.

flavor: The stone is worn and smooth.
name: Worry Rock
text:
Fast.
[reaction] When a scenario card effect discards Worry Rock from your hand: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)

flavor: A traditional Abenaki doll made to look like Mother Rachel.
name: Corn Husk Doll
text:
Fast. Uses (3 wishes).
[reaction] When a [skull] or [tablet] token is revealed at your location, spend 1 wish and exhaust Corn Husk Doll: Treat that token as a [cultist] token instead.

name: The Pearl Diary
text: (Day [day]) You get +1 [intellect]. (Night [night]) You get +1 [willpower]. [reaction] After an investigator at your location draws a [[Blight]] or [[Power]] card from the encounter deck, exhaust The Pearl Diary: That investigator draws 1 card.

back_flavor:
After more aeons of descent I saw some side passages or burrows leading from unknown recesses of blackness to this shaft of nighted mystery.
 – H. P. Lovecraft, "The Festival"
flavor: The open paths seem safe enough... but are they?
name: Dry Burrow
text: (Day [day]) [fast] : Move (to a connecting location). (Group limit once per round.) (Night [night]) Forced – After you end your turn in Dry Burrow: Take 1 horror.

back_flavor:
After more aeons of descent I saw some side passages or burrows leading from unknown recesses of blackness to this shaft of nighted mystery.
 – H. P. Lovecraft, "The Festival"
flavor: The rock formations resemble a jagged grove, wreathed in poisonous red gas.
name: Alkaline Forest
text: Forced – After you reveal Alkaline Forest: You must either take 1 direct horror, or discard 2 cards at random from your hand.

back_flavor:
After more aeons of descent I saw some side passages or burrows leading from unknown recesses of blackness to this shaft of nighted mystery.
 – H. P. Lovecraft, "The Festival"
flavor: The mirror-like walls reflect your fractured face.
name: Iridescent Passage
text: Forced – After you fail a skill test while investigating Iridescent Passage: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

back_flavor:
After more aeons of descent I saw some side passages or burrows leading from unknown recesses of blackness to this shaft of nighted mystery.
 – H. P. Lovecraft, "The Festival"
flavor: Thick sinewy roots choke the surrounding tunnels.
name: Overgrown Tunnel
text: While Overgrown Tunnel has clues on it, you must spend 1 additional action to move out of Overgrown Tunnel.

back_flavor:
After more aeons of descent I saw some side passages or burrows leading from unknown recesses of blackness to this shaft of nighted mystery.
 – H. P. Lovecraft, "The Festival"
flavor: The formations resemble a shark's many-rowed teeth, and are just as sharp.
name: Mineral Tunnel
text: While you are investigating Mineral Tunnel, it gets +1 shroud for each card in your hand (max +6 shroud on Easy/Standard difficulty).

name: Crystal Parasite
text: Hunter. Retaliate. (Day [day]) Forced – After Crystal Parasite attacks: Heal 2 damage from it. (Night [night]) Crystal Parasite gets +2 fight and +1 damage value for every 2 damage on it.

name: Chroma Blight
text: Revelation – Put Chroma Blight into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced – After you draw 1 or more cards from your deck: Place 1 resource on Chroma Blight, as brilliance. Forced – If there is a total of 6 brilliance on Chroma Blight: Put a set-aside copy of Crystal Parasite into play at your location. Remove Chroma Blight from the game.

name: Calcification
text: Revelation – Put Calcification into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced – The first time you move each round: Take 1 direct damage. [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Calcification. (You may take 1 direct damage for this test to automatically succeed.)

name: Miasmatic Shadow
text: Aloof. Hunter. (Night [night]) Elusive. Cannot be damaged except by [[Spell]], [[Relic]], [[Science]], or encounter cards. Forced – When you discard 1 or more cards from hand at Miasmatic Shadow's location, if it is ready: It engages you and makes an immediate attack.

name: Alien Whispers
text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must (choose one): - Take 1 damage, which can only be assigned to an asset you control. - Take 1 horror, which can only be assigned to an asset you control. - Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

flavor: Knotty, scaly growths erupt on the skin, resembling scales or vestigial fingernails.
name: Strange Mutations
text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (5). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each horror on you. If you fail, you must either take 2 horror, or discard 2 cards at random from your hand.

name: Fungal Rot
text: Revelation – Attach Fungal Rot to an [[Item]] asset you control without Fungal Rot attached. If you cannot, Fungal Rot gains surge. Treat attached asset's text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]). [action]: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, discard Fungal Rot. Otherwise, take 1 damage.

flavor: The sores won't heal on their own, and emit a sharp chemical scent.
name: Enervation
text: Revelation – Test [combat] (5). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each damage on you. If you fail, you must either take 2 damage, or choose the card with the highest printed cost in your hand and discard it.

name: Dessication
text: Revelation – Put Dessication into play next to the agenda deck. As an additional cost for an investigator to play a card, they must take 1 damage. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Dessication from play. (Max once per round.)

name: Empyrean Brilliance
text: (Day [day]) Revelation – Test 2 [willpower]. Increase the difficulty of this test by 2 if you have 5 or more cards in hand. If you fail, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand. (Night [night]) Revelation – Discard 1 card at random from your hand. Test [willpower] (X). X is that card's printed cost. If you fail, take 2 horror.

flavor: Who do you see beyond the veil?
name: Captivating Gleam
text: Surge. Revelation – Put Captivating Gleam into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced – If you have no cards in hand: Take 5 horror and discard Captivating Gleam.

flavor:
"...and their spores smell of rotting meat."
 - Dr. Rosa Marquez, Miskatonic Survey, 1926
name: Black Amanita
text: (Day [day]) Aloof. (Night [night]) Massive. Forced - After you discover a clue at Black Amanita's location or a connecting location, if it is ready: Take 1 direct horror.

flavor: The lichens animate the fleshless bones.
name: Corpse Lichen
text: (Day [day]) Corpse Lichen cannot move. (Night [night]) Hunter. Alert. Forced - After Corpse Lichen attacks: Heal 1 damage from it.

name: Psychotropic Spores
text: Revelation - Put Psychotropic Spores into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - The first time you draw 1 or more cards from your deck each round: Take 1 direct horror. [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Psychotropic Spores. (You may take 1 direct horror for this test to automatically succeed.)

name: Sudden Mutation
text: Revelation – Attach to the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy. If you cannot, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Mutated]] enemy and draw it. Forced – When attached enemy is defeated: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and spawn it at this location.

flavor:
"It is not the strongest of the species that survives, not the most intelligent that survives. It is the one that is most adaptable to change"
 - Charles Darwin
name: Unnatural Growth
text: Revelation – Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy with no doom on it. If no doom was placed by this effect, discard 2 cards at random from your hand.

name: Fire!
text: Revelation – Attach Fire! to the nearest location with no copy of Fire! attached (connected to a location with Fire! attached, if able). [action]: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard Fire! Forced – At the end of the round: Each card with health at this location takes 1 direct damage.
